pullRequest.title: Server side corfu metrics
pullRequest.bodyText:
Overview
Description:
Enable some server metrics.
Why should this be merged:
Related issue(s) (if applicable): #
Checklist (Definition of Done):

 There are no TODOs left in the code
 Coding conventions (e.g. for logging, unit tests) have been followed
 Change is covered by automated tests
 Public API has Javadoc

nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -41,6 +62,22 @@ public static synchronized void init(Logger logger, Duration loggingInterval,
             init(loggingInterval, localEndpoint, influxLineProtocolLoggingSink);
         }
 
+        /**
+         * Configure the meter registry of type LoggingMeterRegistry. All the metrics registered
+         * with this meter registry will be exported in the InfluxDB line protocol format
+         * (https://docs.influxdata.com/influxdb/v1.8/write_protocols/line_protocol_tutorial/)
+         * with  the provided loggingInterval frequency.
+         * @param logger A configured logger.
+         * @param loggingInterval A duration between log appends for every metric.
+         */
+        public static synchronized void init(Logger logger, Duration loggingInterval) {

nodes.bodyText: looks like we don't need another future here, it's enough just stop the timer
It seems to me this method is the same as CompletableFuture.allOf(...)
This is not the fsync latency, but rather the fsync time of all dirty segments. Based on the current batch + segment size at most it the sum of fsyncing two files.
Having a histogram on the batch size/queue size can help answer questions about queuing delay.
This is a really short period given that most of the metrics collected are aggregates.
Can you also capture stats on the hit ratio, load time and total weight.
Can you also capture histogram of the number of queues per transaction.
We need to capture stats on the window size and number of evictions per trim call.
Can you just enable this by default and add the logging information in infrastructure/src/main/resources/logback.prod.xml
